intro: Gamogyne, commonly known as the golden weed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small yellow flowers that are often clustered together, giving it a bright, eye-catching appearance. Gamogyne is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture.
